column2: Number and percentage of public school students retained, by race/ethnicity, disability status, and English proficiency, by gender and grade: School Year 2011-12

column21: Students With Disabilities Served Under IDEA
column23: Students With Disabilities Served Only Under Section 504

column11: Hispanic or Latino of any race
column17: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

column2: NOTE: Table reads:  Of all 1,507 public school students retained in kindergarten, 7 (0.5%) were American Indian or Alaska Native, 204 (13.5%) were students with disabilities served under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA), and 7 (0.5%) were students with disabilities served solely under Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973.
The ‘1-3’ reference indicates that the data have been suppressed based on the schools’ reported n-size, and that the midpoint was used to calculate the total.

SOURCE: U.S. Department of Education, Office for Civil Rights, Civil Rights Data Collection, 2011-12, available at http://ocrdata.ed.gov. Data notes are available at http://ocrdata.ed.gov/downloads/DataNotes.docx
